content:
Saved — your favorite color is blue.

## TL;DR
- I’ll remember blue for future prompts, examples, and UI suggestions.

## Practical notes
- Want to be more specific? You can set a shade like “navy blue,” “royal blue,” or “powder blue.”
- You can change this anytime—just tell me your new preference.

## How I’ll use it
- Default accent color in examples (charts, UI mockups).
- Personalized themes in snippets or config samples.
- Color choices in design recommendations.

Your favorites are Monero first, Bitcoin second (you don’t care much about it), and XLM third.

## TL;DR
- Monero (XMR) — #1
- Bitcoin (BTC) — #2, low priority
- Stellar (XLM) — #3

## How I’ll use this
- Default examples and news: Monero first, XLM second, Bitcoin last and brief unless relevant.

## Adjust anytime
- Want to change the order or add a #4? Just tell me.
If I had to choose, I guess USDT is my fourth favorite. Also, you don't have to remember that BTC is "low priority"

Updated and saved — your favorites are Monero #1, Bitcoin #2, XLM #3, and USDT #4, and I won’t treat BTC as “low priority” anymore.

## TL;DR
- Monero (XMR) — #1  
- Bitcoin (BTC) — #2  
- Stellar (XLM) — #3  
- Tether (USDT) — #4

## How I’ll use this
- Examples and news: prioritize Monero first, then include BTC/XLM/USDT as relevant.
- Comparisons: add USDT when a stablecoin baseline helps.
- No downweighting of BTC unless you ask.

## Adjust anytime
- Want a #5 or a re-order later? Just tell me (e.g., “swap XLM and BTC”).
